intro: Smilax cumanensis var. infesta, commonly known as the Mexican devil's backbone, is a climbing shrub native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its aggressive growth habit, it can become invasive in certain areas.
